meanings.definition: The state of being devoid of emotion.
meanings.sent1: Her emotionlessness made it difficult for others to understand her feelings.
meanings.sent2: The emotionlessness in his eyes was unsettling to those around him.
meanings.sent3: Despite his emotionlessness, he still found joy in simple pleasures like watching the sunset.
meanings.sent4: The emotionlessness of the robot was a stark reminder of its artificial nature.
meanings.sent5: The emotionlessness of the room was eerie, as if all feelings had been sucked out of it.

meanings.definition: The quality of lacking feeling or sentiment.
meanings.sent1: The emotionlessness of the situation left everyone feeling numb.
meanings.sent2: Her face remained a mask of emotionlessness throughout the entire meeting.
meanings.sent3: The emotionlessness of the rock made it the perfect paperweight.
meanings.sent4: The emotionlessness of the painting gave it a haunting quality.
meanings.sent5: The emotionlessness of his voice made it hard to tell if he was joking or serious.
